content.text:
[@rjkip](@ctLmxhUiEPou/jxfKyGxs+nVh6XcM6uCCg0ldePkLGc=.ed25519)  /  [@rjkip ‚ìÇÔ∏è](@9lx49s9tig9q5wCSkUps1fhMzRfc/JofzBCGPLzeQec=.ed25519)

My kombucha scoby has been sitting dormant for a few months and when I went out of town for a few days I came back to a pile of mold. Boo. I looked around the web for other fermented beverages I could experiment with and found this weird "ginger bug" idea, and I was *so excited* to search SSB and find that your post was **already on my computer**. Scuttlebutt magic!

I see you haven't been on in a few months, but if you have any thoughts from recent attempts. Especially:

> I might try even preparing the the mix like this, stir it throughout the day, and then put it in a vessel, no bug. Wouldn‚Äôt surprise me if that would work very well üëå

Thanks for posting this! I'm excited to try to make a ginger bug.
